criteria.name: Direct Correspondence
criteria.description: Each problem statement has a clearly corresponding solution that directly addresses it.

criteria.name: Completeness
criteria.description: All identified problems have corresponding solutions, with no problems left unaddressed.

criteria.name: Clarity of Connection
criteria.description: The connection between each problem and its solution is explicitly stated and easy to understand.

criteria.name: Logical Flow
criteria.description: The progression from problem to solution follows a logical sequence and rationale.

criteria.name: Effectiveness Match
criteria.description: The proposed solutions are proportional and appropriate to the scale and severity of the problems.

criteria.name: Precision Mapping
criteria.description: Solutions address the specific aspects and nuances of each problem statement.

criteria.name: Coherence
criteria.description: The connections between problems and solutions form a coherent overall narrative.

criteria.name: Relevance
criteria.description: The connections focus on the most relevant aspects of the problems and solutions.

criteria.name: Root Cause Orientation
criteria.description: Solutions address root causes identified in the problem statements, not just symptoms.

criteria.name: Traceability
criteria.description: Each connection can be traced back to research findings and client requirements.

evaluationInstructions: Evaluate the connection pairs against each criterion. For each criterion, provide a score between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is completely failing to meet the criterion and 1.0 is perfectly meeting it. Provide specific feedback for scores below the pass threshold.
